scenarioDescription:
The HD 134060 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 134060 is a star with 1.09 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 78.32 light years away from the solar system.

HD 134060 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 134060 system


HD 134060 b

HD 134060 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 134060 b is 10.112 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 134060 b is 3.160 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 134060 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 134060 c

HD 134060 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.39 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 134060 c is 29.320 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 134060 c is 5.910 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 134060 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 134060, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 134060 - System With 2 Exoplanets
